Typedef Documentation

typedef struct _nitf_DateTime nitf_DateTime

The DateTime structure represents time. All dates are stored to reflect the coordinated universal time (UTC). The precision depends on the host machine. In many cases, seconds is the highest amount of granularity.

NITF_BOOL nitf_DateTime_format ( nitf_DateTime *  dateTime,
const char *  format,
char *  outBuf,
size_t  maxSize,
nitf_Error *  error 
)

Formats a DateTime object using the given format string and output buffer.

Parameters:
dateTime the DateTime object
format the format string (uses the srftime format)
outBuf the output buffer to write to (passed in & pre-allocated)
maxSize the maximum size of the formatted output
error the error object
Returns:
NITF_SUCCESS or NITF_FAILURE

NITF_BOOL nitf_DateTime_formatMillis ( double  millis,
const char *  format,
char *  outBuf,
size_t  maxSize,
nitf_Error *  error 
)

Uses the input milliseconds since the epoch as the DateTime to format using the given format string and output buffer.

Parameters:
millis the # of milliseconds since the epoch
format the format string (uses the srftime format)
outBuf the output buffer to write to (passed in & pre-allocated)
maxSize the maximum size of the formatted output
error the error object
Returns:
NITF_SUCCESS or NITF_FAILURE

nitf_DateTime* nitf_DateTime_fromMillis ( double  millis,
nitf_Error *   
)

Returns a DateTime object created from the milliseconds since the epoch: January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.
